trend_summary: Across the series the built-up footprint widens gradually, especially around the south-west industrial/port zone and along the central transport corridor. Residential quarters show steady infill while forest pockets shrink slightly but some new roadside greenery appears. Road capacity improves, indicating rising traffic. Overall change is incremental, with no abrupt megaprojects.
notable_changes: Progressive expansion of warehouses and hardstand in the south-west port/industrial area.
Residential infill and replacement of detached houses with denser blocks in central and north-east neighbourhoods.
Extension/widening of the main northâ€“south highway and new feeder roads.
Minor reduction of forest patches, especially beside the transport corridor.
Addition of landscaped strips and sports grounds enhancing local green space.
